introduction: What is something? On the most fundamental level thinkable, what are things? Why are things? And why
lead_intro: Have you ever wondered what everything around you is made of? Dive into the world of particle physics to uncover the building blocks of the universe.

quiz.question: What are the 3 categories that the 17 particles produced by the fields of the universe can be divided into?
quiz.explanation: The 17 particles in the universe are divided into leptons, quarks, and bosons.

quiz.question: Which force is responsible for building every molecule by governing all atomic bonds?
quiz.explanation: Electromagnetism governs all atomic bonds, which are vital for building molecules.

quiz.question: What are the messengers passed between matter particles to tell each other how to move?
quiz.explanation: Bosons act as messengers passed between matter particles, guiding their movement.

quiz.question: Which force attracts matter, leading to the formation of planets and stars?
quiz.explanation: Gravity is the force that attracts matter, playing a crucial role in building planets and stars.

quiz.question: What is the theory that describes the 17 particles and 4 fundamental forces discovered in particle physics?
quiz.explanation: The Standard Model of Particle Physics is the theory that encompasses the 17 particles and 4 fundamental forces discovered in particle physics.
